intro: Hoya maquilingensis, commonly known as the Maquiling Hoya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asclepiadaceae. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is a succulent plant that thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. Hoya maquilingensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
